text: The Kyrgyzata Botanical Reserve () is located in Nookat District of Jalal-Abad Province of Kyrgyzstan. It was established in 1975 with a purpose of conservation of standard natural area where ixiolirion, colchicum, crocus, and tulip (Tulipa ferganica Vved. and Tulipa turkestanica (Regel)) grow. The botanical reserve occupies 30 hectares. ==References== Category:Protected areas of Kyrgyzstan Category:Protected areas established in 1975
title: Kyrgyzata Botanical Reserve
